name: Additive basis
summary:
In additive number theory, an additive basis is a set 
  
    
      
        S
      
    
    {\displaystyle S}
  
 of natural numbers with the property that, for some finite number 
  
    
      
        k
      
    
    {\displaystyle k}
  
, every natural number can be expressed as a sum of 
  
    
      
        k
      
    
    {\displaystyle k}
  
 or fewer elements of 
  
    
      
        S
      
    
    {\displaystyle S}
  
. That is, the sumset of 
  
    
      
        k
